page.title: 13THE MINK FARM
page.content: {Kippen Mink Farm}is situated about two miles south of Kippen Cross.It is run by{Mr.A.Neill}with the help of two workers.He started with two mink as a hobby before going into business 15 years ago.There are{7500}white,light and dark brown and black mink in cages at the farm.They are sociable animals and prefer to have company in their cages-if the wire between cages is damaged all the animals from both will move in together!They are fed twice a day on a mixture of animal and fish offal and meal.The babies are born in May and kept until the pelts are at their best in December when they are killed and skinned.The pelts are sent to{London}where they are sold.It takes 30 skins to make a jacket.The tails are used for hats.Mr.Neill keeps some females for breeding and the usual litter size is five.
